problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What does the term 'purity of a substance' usually refer to?
options: The percentage of the desired substance in a sample
problems.hint: Purity compares the mass of the pure substance to the total mass.
problems.detailed: Purity is defined as the percentage of the desired pure substance in a sample, relative to the total mass of the sample.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is the correct formula for calculating percentage purity?
options: \( \frac{\text{Mass of impure sample}}{\text{Mass of pure substance}} \times 100 % \)
\( \frac{\text{Mass of pure substance}}{\text{Mass of impure sample}} \times 100 % \)
\( \frac{\text{Total mass of impurities}}{\text{Mass of impure sample}} \times 100 % \)
problems.hint: The pure mass is compared against the whole sample mass.
problems.detailed: Percentage purity is calculated using the formula: \(%\text{ Purity} = \dfrac{\text{Mass of pure substance}}{\text{Mass of impure sample}} \times 100 % \).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A sample of impure sodium chloride weighs 20 g. If it contains 18 g of pure NaCl, what is its percentage purity?
problems.hint: Use \(%\text{ Purity} = \dfrac{\text{Mass of pure substance}}{\text{Mass of impure sample}} \times 100 % \).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: If a reaction requires 10 g of pure substance but you have a 50 g impure sample with 40% purity, how much pure substance does it actually contain?
problems.hint: Multiply the impure mass by the percentage purity fraction.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Why is it important to know the purity of a substance in chemical reactions?
options: To predict the melting point only
To calculate the correct amount of reactants needed
To change the color of the product
To reduce the density of the solution
problems.detailed: Knowing purity ensures correct stoichiometric amounts of reactants are used, as impurities can alter the effective mass of the reactive substance.
